extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds Brussels sprouts, thinly sliced in a food processor
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brussels sprouts, thinly sliced in a food processor

extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apples
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Granny Smith apples—peeled, cored, coarsely shredded and squeezed dry
extendedIngredients.originalName: Granny Smith apples—peeled, cored, coarsely shredded and squeezed dry

extendedIngredients.name: thick-cut bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 pound thick-sliced bacon, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

title: Warm Brussels Sprout Slaw with Bacon
summary: Warm Brussels Sprout Slaw with Bacon is a gluten free and primal recipe with 10 servings. One serving contains 240 calories, 8g of protein, and 18g of fat. For $1.31 per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It works well as a rather inexpensive side dish. A mixture of thyme leaves, butter, salt and pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 49%. This score is good. Try Warm Bacon Brussels Sprout Salad with Chicken, Warm Brussel Sprout Slaw with Bacon and Green Apples, and Chicken Bacon Burgers with Brussels Sprout, Apple, Avocado Slaw for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the bacon over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 6 minutes. Drain on paper towels; reserve 1/4 cup of fat.                                               In a large, enameled cast-iron casserole, melt the butter in the bacon fat. Add the Brussels sprouts in batches and cook over high heat, stirring, until softened but still bright green, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the apples and thyme; cook, stirring, until the apples are warmed through. Transfer the slaw to a platter, scatter the bacon on top and serve.

steps.step: In a large skillet, cook the bacon over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 6 minutes.
Drain on paper towels; reserve 1/4 cup of fat.
In a large, enameled cast-iron casserole, melt the butter in the bacon fat.
Add the Brussels sprouts in batches and cook over high heat, stirring, until softened but still bright green, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the apples and thyme; cook, stirring, until the apples are warmed through.
Transfer the slaw to a platter, scatter the bacon on top and serve.
